paragraphs.text: Think that scenario is too harsh? Think again. That’s what brutal honesty does to people. Why? Feedback, criticism, etc, is often viewed as an attack. That has nothing to do with you. Most people are bad at receiving feedback. Again, we’re human beings. We don’t like it.
paragraphs.name: fc42

paragraphs.text: Look, you can pretend it’s not about appearances at work, but it is. Looking busy and actually being busy are the same thing.
paragraphs.name: 110e

paragraphs.text: Think that scenario is too harsh? Think again. That’s what brutal honesty does to people. Why? Feedback, criticism, etc, is often viewed as an attack. That has nothing to do with you. Most people are bad at receiving feedback. Again, we’re human beings. We don’t like it.
paragraphs.name: fc42
fc42
paragraphs.text: Think that scenario is too harsh? Think again. That’s what brutal honesty does to people. Why? Feedback, criticism, etc, is often viewed as an attack. That has nothing to do with you. Most people are bad at receiving feedback. Again, we’re human beings. We don’t like it.

paragraphs.name: 537f
paragraphs.text: So please, prove me wrong and make change happen at your company. Because I hope that these truths become misconceptions in the future.
But we need you to make that happen.

fffcdfefd1f6.title: OK. At least do not stop being brutally honest.

paragraphs.text: OK. At least do not stop being brutally honest. This nice piece wouldn’t have been without your honesty though.
paragraphs.name: f6ef

paragraphs.text: A good read.
paragraphs.name: d18c

eae8aa1a9e46.title: The people who directly work with you can tell the difference.

paragraphs.text: The people who directly work with you can tell the difference. It’s possible to exaggerate your ‘brand’ within the company certainly by appearing to be better than you are, but if you don’t get stuff done, people will notice.
paragraphs.name: 2feb

paragraphs.text: If you’re good you can probably fake being great, but if you’re bad, it’s impossible to fake being great.
paragraphs.name: ad01

paragraphs.text: Darius, At first I did not read to the end and I was thinking “I believe just the opposite.” It’s a rare culture and place that foster the goodness we all have. However we can make this different, let’s all do our parts — from inside as intrepreneurs or from Outside as change agents. Thanks for speaking your truth and helping others be the change.

paragraphs.text: The looking busy part. I remember I was at a F500 a few decades ago (you can read my CV to piece it together) and this one field operations manager was promoted into a staff position where he oversaw special projects, etc. He was used to line authority where what you got done was more valued than how you did it. He saw himself as efficient, orderly…

virtuals.subtitle: A few months into the job he was viewed by his peers and bosses as someone who was never on top of the projects he was managing because he…
